page.title: 04Trades in Horncliffe
page.content: We have one public house in the village the "Fisher's Arms", mine hosts are Mr & Mrs D. Storar, the pub also doubles as a sweet shop for the children of the village since the closure of the Village Shop in 1984 which was owned and run by Mr & Mrs C. Robertson.We are now served by Mobile Vans for Butchery,Bakery,Fish,Coal and Lemonade etc. In the mid_seventies we had our own petrol pump serviced by Mr R. Simpson who was also the village Blacksmith, although the petrol dried up long ago and Mr Simpson is retired, the Smithy still works as well as ever,whenever it is needed. The old Horncliffe Mill is now converted into a pig farm.
